title: Question 1
question: The lower limbs are connected to the trunk by:

title: Question 2
question: The lower limbs are divided into 04 parts, which are:

options.label: Hip, femur, tibia and tarsal bones

title: Question 3
question: The cingulate of the lower limb is formed by:

options.label: Through the femur and pubic symphysis
By the femur and the bony pelvis
02 hip bones (unique in the pubic symphysis) and the coccyx
02 hip bones (unique in the pubic symphysis) and the sacrum

title: Question 4
question: The hip bone is formed by the fusion of the bones:

options.label: Bone pelvis, symphysis pubis and acetabulum

title: Question 5
question: Which femur is articulated in which hip structure?

title: Question 6
question: Of the following structures, which is not present in the femur bone?

title: Question 7
question: What are the bones that make up the leg?

title: Question 8
question: What is the location of the tibia bone?

options.label: Located in the anterior and lateral portion of the leg
Located in the posterior and medial portion of the leg
Located in the posterior and lateral portion of the leg
Located in the anterior and medial portion of the leg

title: Question 9
question: Where is the fibula bone located?

options.label: Located in the posterior and lateral portion of the leg
Located in the anterior and lateral portion of the leg
Located in the posterior and medial portion of the leg
Located in the anterior and medial portion of the leg

title: Question 10
question: The bones of the foot include:

title: Question 11
question: Tarsal bones consist of seven bones, which are:

options.label: Tarsus, calcaneus, cuboid, navicular, talus and 2 cuneiform bones
Calcaneal, navicular, cuboid, and 4 cuneiform bones
Tarsus, metatarsus, cuboid and 3 cuneiform bones
Calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular and 3 cuneiform bones

title: Question 12
question: What is the biggest and most resistant foot bone?

title: Question 13
question: The first toe is called:

title: Question 14
question: How many phalanxes make up the foot?

title: Question 15
question: Of the following fascias, which one does not belong to the lower limbs?

title: Question 16
question: What are the main superficial veins of the lower limbs?

options.label: Femoral vein and dorsal digital veins
Great saphenous vein and small saphenous vein
Great saphenous vein and femoral vein

title: Question 17
question: Which of the following nerves does not correspond to the innervation of the lower limbs?

title: Question 18
question: Which of the following muscles corresponds to the anterior thigh muscle?

title: Question 19
question: The femoral triangle is limited by:

options.label: Coxofemoral ligament (superiorly), sartorius muscle (medially), and sartorius muscle (laterally)
Inguinal ligament (superiorly), gracilis muscle (medially), and adductor magnus muscle (laterally)
Inguinal ligament (superiorly), long adductor muscle (medially), and sartorius muscle (laterally)
Coxofemoral ligament (superiorly), long adductor muscle (medially) and gracilis muscle (laterally)

title: Question 20
question: The main artery of the lower limb, and its origin, corresponds to the following alternative:

options.label: Femoral artery. It originates from the external pudendal artery
Femoral artery. It originates from the internal iliac artery
Femoral artery. It originates from the external iliac artery
Femoral artery. It originates from the obturator artery
